project_descr: Strengthening national capacities for Tsunami early warning and response systems

outputs.output_descr: Following the Indian Ocean-wide disaster caused by tsunamis in December 2004, the Mauritian Government finalised a Tsunami Emergency Scheme along the line of schemes related to other natural disasters.  Also in order to participate more actively in the regional effort to mitigate the impact of tsunamis, Mauritius considers it important to provide monitoring information obtained from its outer islands, namely Rodrigues, St Brandon and Agalega.  Awareness raising activities are also scheduled to prepare the general public and key stakeholders in the event of a tsunami.  This is a UNISDR supported project for the setting up of the Mauritius Tsunami Emergency Scheme-in terms of provision of appropriate equipment and awreness raising programmes.

project_title: mauritius tsunami early warning and mitigation system
